title: Product Owner #: 24-02495
job_description: Job Description The Research Department is looking for a Product Owner to work with a dedicated scrum team made of developers, tester, business analyst, and scrum master to build solutions by writing user stories and defining clear acceptance criteria to address the needs of the customer. You will manage and prioritize the product backlog. You will also participate in regular team ceremonies (standups, planning, reviews, refinements, and retrospectives) and inspect progress of every sprint. The Product Owner will be an expert in the product areas and develop high functioning relationships with other stakeholders.Responsibilities Serve as the product owner on one of the App modernization development team, supporting projects on web applications in the Research Department, such as FRED , ALFRED and others. Main area of focus will be on technical modernization and 508 compliance of FRED website. Manage and prioritize backlog related to app tech modernization projects, change the order of items in the prioritized list of requirements as needed to maintain a cohesive vision regarding the product. Maximizing the value produced by the team and ensuring stories meet the user’s needs and comply with the Definition of Done. Providing clarification necessary to assist the team with their story estimates and sequencing including writing requirements, refining user stories, planning stories into sprints. Work with the development team to inspect and evaluate product progress through each iteration. Gather information and provide results to team to determine performance level and readiness to move on to next steps in the product roadmap. Collaborate with other agile teams on cross teamwork dependency. Participate in all pre-planning, stand-up, backlog refinement, reviews, retrospectives, roadmaps, and other meetings as requested. Build release plan and confirm feasibility and estimate efforts of projects with respect to business objectives and report to product manager. Track progress towards the desired outcomes for web applications. Work with team to identify and organize the steps required for each iteration in product development. Collaborate with business owners on production deployments and testing needs. Promptly provide written status updates to the Bank, as requested.Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or commensurate experience. PMP, Scrum, and Agile certifications preferred. 3+ years’ relevant experience in a role requiring technical acumen. Demonstrated experience in an Agile work environment utilizing Scrum methodologies and Agile tools (Digital.ai or similar). Demonstrated experience in quickly developing an advanced understanding of current business processes and products. Strong analytical and writing skills including solid experience in writing functional specifications. Advanced ability to communicate and collaborate effectively and confidently with users, team members, program management and stakeholders. Skilled at establishing and maintaining organizational relationships with a diverse group of people, in a combined virtual and in-person environment. Perform as a flexible, dependable self-starter capable of gathering information quickly and applying it to projects. Experience working with economic information preferred.
Industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Accounting, and Financial Services

title: Senior Director of Finance
job_description: On June 16, 2022, Governor Kathy Hochul signed the NYC Public Housing Preservation Trust Act, which authorized creation of the NYC Public Housing Preservation Trust (the Trust). The Trust is a public benefit corporation that will oversee the renovation and rehabilitation of the city’s public housing developments, owned by the New York City Housing Authority (NYCHA). NYCHA remains permanent owner of the land/buildings and enters into a long-term ground lease with the Trust to secure Section 8 vouchers, a subsidy worth double NYCHA’s current federal subsidy. Similar to how other government entities raise revenue for capital improvements, the Trust will issue bonds that fund comprehensive building renovations. The Trust Act limits the Trust’s initial unit volume to 25,000 units. No NYCHA site can convert to the Trust without a positive vote of the site’s residents. Under the Act, NYCHA must develop and administer a voting process to provide residents with that choice.The Trust Act took effect on August 15, 2022, and the Trust will be built by its initial seven-member board and a small staff. As the Trust assumes a full workload in 2024 – including leasehold contracts with NYCHA, Section 8 conversions with the Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD), and the procurement of design-build partners to perform construction work – the Trust will continue to add staff to fulfill critical functions.Position SummaryThe Senior Director of Finance will play a pivotal role in the Public Housing Preservation Trust by overseeing and implementing a financial strategy for the Trust, establishing and executing financial operations, leading budgeting and financial planning initiatives, completing and overseeing required financial reporting, managing payments and executing cash optimization strategies and investments, and collaborating with the Trust’s capital team and asset management team to set capital and operating plans for the developments the Trust oversees through a long-term ground lease with NYCHA.Primary ResponsibilitiesThe primary responsibilities of the Senior Director of Finance include, but are not limited to: Develop an enduring, long-term financial strategy for the Trust that establishes a stable foundation for the execution of our mission to safeguard public housing. Build a financial operations team, systems, and processes that can enable the Trust to scale, including payments, accounting, reporting, treasury, and FP&A functions. Establish accounting and reporting requirements for NYCHA on the properties it manages on behalf of the Trust and to satisfy reporting to lenders, public officials, and others. Collaborate with the Trust’s legal, asset management and capital teams on systems and processes to monitor the overall financial and operational health of each development the Trust oversees, including individualized property M&O budgets and capital plans. Evaluate the development of pro formas and operating plans for planned modernizations and financing and work with lenders and other funding sources to source project funding.Additional Information NYCHA employees applying for promotional, title or level change opportunities must have served a period of one year at current location and in current title and level (if applicable). NYCHA residents are encouraged to apply.Please read this posting carefully to make certain you meet the minimum qualification requirements before applying to this position.Minimum Qualifications A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and three years of full-time paid experience in an administrative, executive or consultative capacity in a large public housing agency; or Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" above.Preferred SkillsKey Competencies - Experience in affordable housing or project-based infrastructure financing, including success structuring and executing on successful preservation projects. - Experience establishing financial policies and procedures, operations, and systems, including the selection and implementation of software platforms to manage payments, accounting, and FP&A. - Excellent communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills to interact effectively with residents, stakeholders, and government agencies. - Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a team and independently to drive results. - Commitment to the Trust's mission of preserving and improving public housing in New York City. Qualification & Experience Preferred - Minimum of 10 years of relevant experience in public finance, with management responsibility over financial planning & analysis (FP&A), accounting, treasury, and a proven track record of implementing and scaling financial operations and a Bachelor's degree in finance, business, accounting, public administration, or a related field. experience. Experience with City, State, or federal grant funding and federal housing programs. - Certified Public Accountant or Certified Financial Analyst preferred, or equivalent. - Strong understanding of laws and regulations applicable to public housing, real estate, and municipal finance. - An understanding of public housing law, bond finance, construction management, and US Department of Housing and Urban Development regulations is a bonus.Public Service Loan ForgivenessAs a prospective employee of the City of New York, you may be eligible for federal loan forgiveness programs and state repayment assistance programs. For more information, please visit the U.S. Department of Education’s website at https://studentaid.gov/pslf/Residency RequirementThe Trust has no residency requirements.Additional InformationThe City of New York is an inclusive equal opportunity employer committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce and providing a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment based upon any legally protected status or protected characteristic, including but not limited to an individual's sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity, or pregnancy., $160,000.00 – $180,000.00

title: Technical Product Owner
job_description: Technical Product Owner Job DescriptionThe Client looking for a Senior Product Owner; PO will be the primary product specialist for the development team. You will team up with the Product Manager and business unit SMEs to elicit business requirements and translate into user stories and acceptance criteria. The Product Owner will work with the Product Architects to refine the Program Backlog to prepare for the PI (Program Increment) planning sessions. PO should be able to prepare in advance to update the team backlog to estimate features for the upcoming Program Increment. Activities will include leading the development team to size features and stories, and figure out what can be committed in the Program Increment based upon the team's established velocity. You will be involved with story definition, providing clarifications necessary to assist the team with their story estimates and story sequencing, and drafting the organizations specific objectives for the upcoming Program Increment (PI). A great technical development background and modern service level architecture awareness will help the PO in the highly technical customer environment.Responsibilities: As a Product Owner,You will own and lead the team's backlog(s)You will participate actively in planning activities for the Program IncrementYou will lead the development team through all activities to support Sprint activitiesYou will be a key partner in product related decisions and release planningYou have an in-depth knowledge of goals and desired objectives of the initiatives and featuresYou will work to drive value as a function of cost, time, functionality and qualityYou will work with Product Manager to evaluate the product Roadmap to identify features for development and identify "definition of done" for each featureYou are able to produce work flows, completes data mapping and performs business process designYou will work alongside the Architect(s) and Tech Lead(s) to identify non-functional requirements such as infrastructure needsYou will plan and handle releasesYou will work with Quality Assurance team member(s) to identify test cases for automated testingRequirementsYou will coordinate with business customers to conduct product integration testing Key Responsibilities Preparation and Participation in PI Planning Program Backlog:Bachelor/master's degree in information management, Business or equivalent.Minimum of 8 years of experience in IT as a Business Analyst or Product Owner. 3-year Product Owner experience is a must.Java/GCP background

title: Security Senior Manager-Oil & Gas Industry
job_description: We AreChoose Accenture for a challenging and rewarding cybersecurity career where the variety of opportunities and challenges allows you to make a difference every day. A place where you can develop your potential and grow professionally, working alongside talented colleagues. The only place where you can learn from our unrivalled experience, while helping our global clients achieve their cybersecurity objectives. If this is your idea of a typical working day, then Accenture is where you should be.Accenture's Global Security practice helps organizations work through complex business and technology issues to provide a straightforward approach to information security. Our security professionals bring deep technology skills and industry knowledge to any organization and work closely with clients to design and implement a security solution closely tied to business objectives. Accenture works with the world’s top Resources companies globally to redefine the future of the industry.Our cybersecurity team supports this mission by helping our clients build and execute against cybersecurity strategies that are tailored to the business drivers, risks, and threats relevant to life sciences companies. They identify and evaluate security gaps, subsequently driving the implementation of solutions to increase resiliency. They possess relevant cybersecurity technical skills through continuous research of the latest security vulnerabilities, threats, capabilities, and mitigation techniques, and apply these through an industry lens. They are expected to anticipate security requirements, analyze, and understand the client security posture and formulate rightsized solutions based on industry leading practices.You AreAs a Resources Senior Manager, you will be responsible for leading and managing complex information security engagements. You will provide cybersecurity subject matter expertise, and drive project delivery execution as the primary point of contact for the project team – often interfacing with client security stakeholders, client business and/or IT stakeholders, Accenture domain experts and other third party teams as needed. You will lead others on your projects, from one to many, across our Analyst, Senior Analyst and Consultant levels. You will be the ultimate problem solver, and will need to lead from the front, ensuring we are partnering with our clients to shape and deliver on committed outcomes.As a Resources Senior Manager, you’ll be part of an industry team focused on acquiring and applying cybersecurity expertise to solve problems across the Resources value chain. You’ll help our clients protect the core of their cybersecurity enterprise, while shaping and delivering protections that extend well into research, development, medical device technology, clinical trials, manufacturing and distribution. You’ll work closely with our Industry team to innovate and shape solutions of the future. Expect to utilize your expertise, or develop additional expertise across the life sciences industry, including pharmaceutical, biotech, medical technology, distributor and consumer health. You’ll be key to supporting the development of go-to-market solutions and responsible for helping implement them for our clients.Lead delivery of Accenture’s Security offerings related to cybersecurity with a focus on cybersecurity strategy definition, security program planning, security operating model design and implementation, cyber risk assessments, and implementation of programs and solutions.Managing and leading largescale complex cybersecurity engagements with resources distributed globally. Performing requirements analysis and developing strategies and solutions for cybersecurity, risk, and information governancePartnering with additional Accenture Industry teams to define and develop new/differentiated go to market solutions for our clients. Establishing trusted relationships with our clients at all levels – from executive sponsors to the client’s own teams of technologists, technicians, and business associatesThe WorkLead delivery of Accenture’s Security offerings related to cybersecurity with a focus on cybersecurity strategy definition, security program planning, security operating model design and implementation, cyber risk assessments, and implementation of programs and solutions.Managing and leading largescale complex cybersecurity engagements with resources distributed globally.Managing the engagement lifecycle – including engagement shaping, scoping, budgets, timelines, risks, issues, and client expectationsCoaching and developing teams of cybersecurity consultants, and analyst.Working directly with clients and Accenture teams to design and implement program strategies for cybersecurity capabilities, such as data protection, insider risk, vulnerability management, security operations, security analytics, application security, cloud security, OT security, and digital identity.Analyzing client’s security posture to create current state assessment, gap analyses, and strategic implementation roadmaps.Performing requirements analysis and developing strategies and solutions for cybersecurity, risk, and information governancePartnering with additional Accenture Industry teams to define and develop new/differentiated go to market solutions for our clients.Establishing trusted relationships with our clients at all levels – from executive sponsors to the client’s own teams of technologists, technicians, and business associatesTravel may be required for this role.  The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.Here’s what you need:Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience. (If associate degree, must have minimum 6 years work experience)Minimum of 5 years of cyber security experience.Minimum of 3 years of experience of cybersecurity solutions with leading vendors for their respective technologiesMinimum of 3 years of experience working with Oil & Gas, Utilities, Chemicals and /or Mining IndustriesBonus points if you have:Ability to lead a team with minimal direction.Previous consulting experienceEagerness to contribute in a team orientated environmentAbility to lead a team with minimal direction.Ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment.Desire to help contribute and grow the practice.Desire to mentor and educate others.Experience in designing, developing, implementing, and managing solutions across various cybersecurity domains (e.g., threat intelligence, vulnerability management, data protection, cloud security, OT security)Excellent communication written and oral, and interpersonal skills.Comfortable with C-Level interactionCompensation at Accenture varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience. title: Product Owner - Recurring Revenue
job_description: Why WWT?At World Wide Technology, we work together to make a new world happen. Our important work benefits our clients and partners as much as it does our people and communities across the globe. WWT is dedicated to achieving its mission of creating a profitable growth company that is also a Great Place to Work for All. We achieve this through our world-class culture, generous benefits and by delivering cutting-edge technology solutions for our clients.WWT was founded in 1990 in St. Louis, Missouri. We employ more than 10,000 people globally and closed nearly $20 billion in revenue in 2023. We have an inclusive culture and believe our core values are the key to company and employee success. WWT is proud to have been included on the FORTUNE "100 Best Places to Work For®" list 13 years in a row!What will you be doing?WWT (World Wide Technology) is looking for an Agile Product Owner to assist with teams' and individuals' delivery of valuable software solutions. The Product Owner is a connector, orchestrator, and navigator between the IT (Information Technology) Organization and the Business, ensuring that the product delivered meets the needs and business requirements of our business partners. The Product Owner turns vision into reality and, with the solution architect, helps guide the delivery team to create innovative solutions in real-world applications.An ideal candidate must have previous experience owning one or more products and have a solid understanding of product management techniques, and a background in recurring revenue offers and/or billing systems. An IT Product Owner plays a key role within agile development teams and is responsible for translating the strategic vision outlined by the IT Product Manager into actionable tasks and features that the development team can implement. Acting as a bridge between stakeholders and the development team, the Product Owner plays a crucial role in defining, prioritizing, and managing the product backlog. They work closely with stakeholders to gather and distill requirements, ensuring that the development team has a clear understanding of what needs to be built and why.Throughout the development process, the Product Owner makes decisions on priorities, clarifies requirements, and provides continuous feedback to the team. Additionally, they participate in sprint planning, monitor progress, and collaborate with the quality assurance team to ensure the final product aligns with customer expectations and business objectives. The role demands a combination of technical understanding, business acumen, and effective communication skills to successfully guide the development team in delivering a product that meets both customer needs and organizational goals.If you are driven, strategic, visionary, analytical, and an amazing teammate and leader, we want to hear from you!Job Responsibilities/Essential FunctionsEnsures alignment and continuity with the Product Manager and business vision. Communicates a clear vision and strategy for the product or service being developed.Gather and prioritize product requirements based on customer feedback, market trends, and business goals, ensuring that the development team has a clear understanding of what needs to be built.Work closely with development teams to ensure that the product is developed in accordance with the Agile methodology, including defining and prioritizing user stories and managing the product backlog.Participate in sprint planning meetings, help the team understand the scope of work for each sprint, and ensure that the development process stays on track.Collect and integrate customer feedback into the product development process, ensuring that the final product meets customer expectations and needs. Desired SkillsExperience in recurring revenue models and billing methodologies. (XaaS, Consumption, usage models)Experience in billing and revenue management, order to cash relating to subscription or SaaS (Software as a Service) based lines of business.Working knowledge of business applications to support quote-to-invoice business processes (CRM/ERP tools such as Oracle NetSuite, RecVue, Salesforce Billing & Revenue Management, Coupa, Etc.)Experience designing & implementing integrations with upstream (quoting) and downstream (invoicing/AP/AR/general ledger) applications.Experience in system implementation/solutions, crafting policies for software operations, and subscription management Experience as a Business Analyst.Experience with Agile Methodologies is required.Effective verbal and written communication for both a technical and non-technical audience.Work ExperienceBachelor’s Degree or 5+ years of relevant experience.2-5 years of experience working as a Product Owner or Product Manager.2-5 years in designing and implementing solutions in a SaaS environment or have worked in revenue or finance operations.2-5 years of relevant experience in recurring revenue product offerings and/or billing models that support recurring revenue.2-5 years of experience working directly with business stakeholders.The well-being of WWT employees is essential. So, when it comes to our benefits package, WWT has one of the best. We offer the following benefits to all full-time employees:Health and Wellbeing: Health, Dental, and Vision Care, Onsite Health Centers, Employee Assistance Program, Wellness ProgramFinancial Benefits: Competitive Pay, Profit Sharing, 401k Plan with Company Matching, Life and Disability Insurance, Tuition ReimbursementPaid Time Off: PTO & Holidays, Parental Leave, Sick Leave, Military Leave, Bereavement Additional Perks: Nursing Mothers Benefits, Voluntary Legal, Pet Insurance, Employee Discount ProgramEqual Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

title: Business Analyst- Cash Product & Banking Services
job_description: SummaryThis role is a member of the Cash Management and Banking Services team, which is responsible for Brokerage Cash Management Accounts, the Bank Sweeps Program, Stifel Bank Deposit Accounts, Credit Cards programs and the Firm’s payments strategy. This will require partnership with Bank Operations, Brokerage Operations, Financial Advisors, and client support teams in support of shared clients and a seamless client experience.Essential Duties & ResponsibilitiesThis person is a subject matter expert in all things deposits and payments with the ability to articulate functionality to clients, sales, operations and vendors alike. A guardian of the client experience this role partners with Private Banking, Digital Solutions, Bank Operations, Brokerage Operations, Marketing and Client Services teams to ensure superior digital delivery, superior product setup and superior operational execution. Works at the intersection of business and technology, tasked with identifying and articulating business needs and turning them into business requirements and functionality to bridge our business teams and our technology teams/vendors. Requires ability to work directly with clients at their locations or via WebEx or phone in support of setup and advance support situations. Works closely with vendor-partners in the identification of best-of-breed products and services and then coordinating/leading cross-functional teams for both the technical and operational implementation and support. Reviews, edits and at times creates business processes and procedures related to the products and services as a way to build and retain institutional knowledge. Interviews, investigates and communicates with clients and internal stakeholders to determine what is and is not working. Takes ownership, prioritizes appropriately, and proposes business and technical solutions to solve issues. QualificationsClearly communicates in verbal and written forms potentially complex issues or concepts. Ability to get up to speed quickly, identify patterns, trends, and gaps on any given topic or situation. Passionate learner of new concepts and willing to tackle uncertainty with enthusiasm. The ability to recognize when meaningful action is required and assume the additional responsibility needed to tackle the challenge at hand. Able to take ownership, prioritizes appropriately, and propose business solutions to solve issuesEducation & ExperienceBachelor's degree required or equivalent experience. 2+ years' related experience in financial services required. Previous experience working with financial advisors or clients in a wealth management setting preferred. Systems & TechnologyProficient with Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook. Understands client/server computing architecture, user interfaces, and application programing interfaces. Understand concepts related to relational databases. Ability to write SQL queries is preferred but not required. About StifelStifel is a more than 130 years old and still thinking like a start-up. We are a global wealth management and investment banking firm serious about innovation and fresh ideas. Built on a simple premise of safeguarding our clients’ money as if it were our own, coined by our namesake, Herman Stifel, our success is intimately tied to our commitment to helping families, companies, and municipalities find their own success.While our headquarters is in St. Louis, we have offices in New York, San Francisco, Baltimore, London, Frankfurt, Toronto, and more than 400 other locations. Stifel is home to approximately 9,000 individuals who are currently building their careers as financial advisors, research analysts, project managers, marketing specialists, developers, bankers, operations associates, among hundreds more. Let’s talk about how you can find your place here at Stifel, where success meets success.At Stifel we offer an entrepreneurial environment, comprehensive benefits package to include health, dental and vision care, 401k, wellness initiatives, life insurance, and paid time off.Stifel is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: SAP Business Systems Analyst (W2 / 1099 / C2C)
job_description: Hiring for SAP Business Systems Analyst and Data Migration Lead (ERP Systems Data Migration from Oracle JDE EnterpriseOne to SAP ECC) role. Professionals suitable for the opportunity below may send their up-to-date resumes to Sriram.Parasa@brainhunter.comRequirement SummaryJob Title/Role: SAP Business Systems Analyst and Business Data Lead (BDL)Project Duration: Initial contract of 12 months, with good possibilities of further extension.Job Location: Saint Peters, Missouri, USA.Remote-Work Options: This is a fully on-site role 5 days/week in the office required.Work Hours: 40 hours per week, typically 8:00 am to 5:00 pm (CST), Monday to Friday.***Role/Job Summary: The role of Business Data Lead is part of the site deployment team and reports to the Site deployment lead. The role focuses on coordinating the Data Migration (DM) activities of a manufacturing or commercial site, under the steer of the central team DM Lead. This role is working with a team of central data experts responsible for the data preparation activities (cleansing & enrichment) using the central team Data Migration technical platform, tools, and governance framework.This role is senior and requires lots of coordination abilities since it sits in the middle of the site business team and is the main point of contact for the central data team (mostly working offshore). The individual must be capable of managing conflicting priorities in a challenging environment at a very fast pace.The SAP BSA & BDL will be performing the major functions listed below. The position may require additional duties/responsibilities that may not be outlined below, and specific functions are subject to change.The Business Data Lead will be performing the major functions listed below. The position may require additional duties/responsibilities that may not be outlined below, and specific functions are subject to change.Work hand-in-hand with the central Data Migration lead on the planned activities to deliver on time, quality & budgetAccountable to ensure that the site data team is following the plan agreed with the central team Advocate of the central team Data Migration methodologyWill identify all the data sources and how data will be sourced fromIf the data doesn't exist in any source system or tool, is accountable for finding where, how, and who is going to source/manage this dataComplete accountability for data preparation progressCan potentially own some tasks where relevant so the individual must be operational (Cf. PROFESSIONAL QUALIFICATIONS/ EXPERIENCE section):- Provide input during data design sessions- Contribute to the definition of data cleansing rules - Prepare and validate dataOwns the data validation and reconciliation process end-to-end which includes:- The identification of the business staff who will check and sign off the data- The identification of the exhaustive list of control checks that will stress the dataSupervise the creation, maintenance, and approval of the project documentationProvide updates, monitor progress, and report issues and risks to the central teamRun weekly operational meetings with the wider data team (called L5 meetings), ensure active participation from the local site team(s), share minutesProfessional Qualifications and Key Skillset for this RoleExcellent understanding of business processes in a CPG environmentAbility to quickly understand IT systems and processes landscapeAbility to quickly understand how data influences the business processes in the current system (JDE)Ability to quickly create a strong network within the local business and remote client sitesGood expertise with I.T. acumen / very comfortable with IT systems overallProject management experienceSAP project implementation in a global environmentSAP ECC navigationERP Data migration experienceAdvanced MS Excel skillsKnowledge of JD Edwards EnterpriseOneERP Data StewardshipPersonal Attributes: Require Ownership, commitment, pro-activity, resilience, and problem-solving focus are the main 5 key soft skills, on top of which:Excellent communication and presentation skillsExperience in managing stakeholders at all levels across the organization and very agile with themExperience in managing teams of operational subject matter expertsAbility to influence individuals outside their reporting linesDetermined and resilient to identify resolutions to issues within own span of controlCalm under pressure, action-orientated, very organized, and disciplinedCurious and eager to learnFast learner and autonomousAble to easily interface and collaborate with a diverse group of individualsHaving a can-do approach and style of operation is an absolute mustExcellent team player***How to Apply: Please email me your up-to-date Resume/CV at Sriram.Parasa@brainhunter.comWe appreciate all the applicants' interest in working with us, however, title: Investment Strategy Analyst
job_description: SummaryThe Investment Strategy Analyst is a contributor to the development and implementation of the Stifel CIO Office offering within Stifel’s Investment Products & Services (IP&S). In this capacity, the Investment Strategy Analyst may work at the direction of other members of the CIO Office, and may interact with both Financial Advisors and their clients. The position requires strong analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills.This role has the ability to be based out of Stifel's NY OfficeEssential Duties And Responsibilities Primary research on investment and macroeconomic themes, drawing upon numerous sources of related data and third party research.  Development of official capital market assumptions (CMAs) for the firm’s strategic asset allocation analysis and resulting SAA model portfolios.  Assessing the work of other market experts to establish Investment themes; present these themes in written materials, multimedia presentations, and live/recorded calls for Financial Advisors.  Management of multi-asset class models/portfolios reflective of the developed investment and macroeconomic themes.  Equity security analysis for positions considered in Stifel Choice portfolios.  Working with the IP&S product groups to commercialize investment themes and portfolio positioning, including structured investments and alternative investments.  Develop key publications and presentations on a daily, weekly, monthly, annual, and ad hoc basis for Financial Advisors and clients.  Engaging advisors and clients in delivering customized investment solutions.  In collaboration with other members of the CIO Office, join financial advisor meetings, client meetings, and represent the CIO Office in public forums, which may infrequently requiring travel by car and/or air to local, regional and/or national destinations. Qualifications Strong qualitative and quantitative skills Knowledge of the financial markets Strong critical thinking abilities Strong interpersonal and communication skills.  Knowledge of securities commensurate with related undergraduate studies.  Some experience working with financial data and related analytical tools a plus. Education And Experience Minimum Required: Bachelor’s degree in Finance or related field or equivalent experience Minimum Required: 0-3 years' of related experienceLicenses and Credentials Minimum Required: Series 7 and 63, or the ability to obtain within 12 months from date of hireSystems and Technology Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook Basic knowledge of financial data/analytical systems and tools, which may include Bloomberg, FactSet, Morningstar Direct, and Microsoft Excel macros (VB). DisclaimerNOTE: Job descriptions are intended to be accurate reflections of those principal job elements essential for making fair pay decisions about jobs. Nothing in this job description restricts management right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.About StifelStifel is a more than 130 years old and still thinking like a start-up. We are a global wealth management and investment banking firm serious about innovation and fresh ideas. Built on a simple premise of safeguarding our clients’ money as if it were our own, coined by our namesake, Herman Stifel, our success is intimately tied to our commitment to helping families, companies, and municipalities find their own success.While our headquarters is in St. Louis, we have offices in New York, San Francisco, Baltimore, London, Frankfurt, Toronto, and more than 400 other locations. Stifel is home to approximately 9,000 individuals who are currently building their careers as financial advisors, research analysts, project managers, marketing specialists, developers, bankers, operations associates, among hundreds more. Let’s talk about how you can find your place here at Stifel, where success meets success.At Stifel we offer an entrepreneurial environment, comprehensive benefits package to include health, dental and vision care, 401k, wellness initiatives, life insurance, and paid time off.Stifel is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Business Analyst - SAP SuccessFactors
job_description: Job DescriptionGardaWorld is a global leader in the security industry, offering integrated security solutions and professional services to a diverse range of customers. Committed to operational excellence and innovation, we provide a dynamic work environment that fosters growth and continuous learning for our employees.We are seeking a SAP Business Analyst to leverage their extensive functional and technical knowledge of SAP SuccessFactors. This role will support implementing and optimizing SAP SuccessFactors platforms related to recruiting, onboarding, and employee data management. Key aspects of this role include collaborating with stakeholders, analyzing processes, ensuring compliance, and proposing innovative solutions. In this role, you will also maintain documentation, monitor key performance indicators (KPIs), and actively contribute to platform enhancements and implementations.Job ResponsibilitiesServe as the primary point of contact for all issues related to recruiting and onboarding platforms and employee data management.Collaborate with vendors and internal teams to promptly resolve technical issues. Work closely with Talent Acquisition and Human Resources to understand and translate their needs into platform requirements and enhancements. Analyze existing recruitment onboarding processes to identify areas for improvement and develop strategies to streamline and optimize processes. Conduct regular audits and quality controls to maintain data integrity and compliance with company policies. Keep abreast of the latest trends, best practices, and technological developments in SAP SuccessFactors and propose innovative solutions to enhance platform functionality. Generate measurement reports and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) related to hiring, retention, and new employee satisfaction. Develop and maintain system documentation, user guides, and training materials, ensuring consistent platform usage and understanding of processes. Participate in implementing new functionality, modules, and enhancements with SAP SuccessFactors platforms. Competence ProfileProven ability to propose solutions and improve processes while maintaining operational efficiency.Strong attention to detail and ability to balance perfection with operational constraints.Adaptability to change and willingness to contribute to team success in an evolving environment.Autonomy, initiative, and creativity in problem-solving.Excellent analytical, planning, and prioritization skills.Superior communication and interpersonal skills for effective collaboration with stakeholders at all levels.RequirementsMinimum of 3 years of experience with SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting, Onboarding, and Employee Central platforms.Bachelor's degree in human resources, information technology, or related field; equivalent combination of education and experience considered.CompensationStarting at $80,000 per yearSalary is commensurate with experienceGardaWorld offers a dynamic work environment where employees can grow and develop professionally. We value diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing equal opportunities for all. If you're looking for a challenging role in a company that values its employees' contributions and supports their growth, we welcome you to join GardaWorld.QualificationsEducation

title: Intern Business Data Analyst
job_description: About The RoleAre you looking for an exciting internship where you’ll have the opportunity to apply the knowledge you’ve learned in a classroom setting while simultaneously gaining practical experience in the Logistics and Tech industries? Are you a highly motivated developing professional dedicated to delivering the very best results? Are you looking for a chance to be mentored by industry thought leaders? Then Uber Freight's Summer Internship might be the perfect opportunity for you! At your disposal will be the tools that helped Uber grow to be a worldwide company.What The Candidate Will DoNaturally curious. You're innovative and creative in your problem-solving and you constantly search for ways to tweak and optimize processes.Passionate for data analysis, data visualization and data scienceFast learner. We're looking for interns who thrive with learning new technologies and don't believe in one-size-fits-all solutions. You should be able to adapt easily to meet the needs of our substantial growth and constantly evolving business environment.A great teammate. You believe that you can achieve more on a team -- that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts. You rely on others' candid feedback for continuous improvement.Participants will get hands-on experience working with operations seeing the day-to-day work such as setting appointments, tracking and tracing shipments, attending regularly scheduled meetings, exposure to leadership, and more. They will also be assigned a special project aligned with company strategic goals and initiatives which they will present recommendations for at the end of the program to a group of executives and senior leaders. Following completion of the internship, participants will be considered for a full-time opportunity.Basic QualificationsActively pursuing a Bachelors, Masters or PhD in Computer Science or a related technical subject area or currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Transportation/Logistics/Supply Chain Management or related fieldAbility to work in one of main centers of excellenceIntermediate Excel knowledgeBasic Tableau and/or Power BI knowledge (willing to learn more and develop expertise)Preferred QualificationsKeen interest in growing a career in logistics and transportation as demonstrated by course work, written work, research, internships, etc.Detailed and multi-task oriented (ability to prioritize and manage many tasks)Exceptional interpersonal communications (demonstrated ability to develop rapport and garner trust with peers, customers, classmates, professors, former employers, etc.)Can demonstrate an aptitude to manage difficult situations objectively and rationally (a thick skin; roll with the punches; resourceful)About Uber FreightUber Freight is a logistics platform and partner with a mission to reimagine the way goods move to help communities thrive. Backed by innovative technology and a dedicated team of domain experts, we provide logistics solutions that give shippers and carriers of all sizes greater reliability, flexibility, and transparency so they can take control of their freight. With over $17 billion in FUM, we’ve built one of the world’s most comprehensive logistics networks consisting of over 130,000 digitally-enabled carriers and thousands of shippers, from small businesses to Fortune 500 companies. For more, visit uberfreight.com.EEOCUber Freight is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.
Industries: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage

title: Operations Analyst

title: Senior Business System Analyst
job_description: Stop searching. Start growing. It’s time to build a meaningful career where you can grow, your ideas can thrive, and you are recognized and valued. Join a team committed to your excellence, and apply to Safety National today!Ready for a rewarding career? Follow this link to view all of our available careers and apply: https://www.safetynational.com/careers-page/This opportunity is in the Information Technology Department.As the company’s largest department, I.T. is responsible for supporting both ongoing operations and our next innovative project. Information technology is prioritized, allowing us to partner with colleagues to securely enable and support new capabilities every day. Utilizing a diverse set of technologies, like Guidewire, Salesforce, Java, C#/.NET, Mule, and Azure, the available career opportunities continue to grow rapidly. Our department consists of agile teams where individual contributions are recognized, and career advancement is nurtured.Role Description:You will be responsible or the collection, preparation, documentation and communication of IS requirements, both business and technical. You will demonstrate clear and working knowledge and concepts of Business Analysis and Information Technology. You will work independently on large/complex projects and will serve as a mentor / advisor to other Business Systems Analysts as required.You will work closely with a delivery team, composed of development and quality assurance personnel, to deliver high- quality applications that meet/exceed business need.You will also work closely with work closely with UI Designers to create highly intuitive applications that meet/exceed business needIn this role some of the essential functions are:Act as liaison between all business departments and the Information Technology departmentEvaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, and break down high-level information into detailed requirements documentation.Ability to organize, facilitate and lead meetings with business users to identify requirements, understand and communicate scope changes, and gain user acceptanceAbility to organize, manage and lead the Business Partners through a vendor selection process including creation and processing of RFI and RFP documentationProvide appropriate feedback to Information Technology ManagementRaise impediments to daily work accordinglyResponsible for timely achievement of milestones and project completionIf this role describes you, don’t delay. Apply today!Qualifications:Education:Bachelor’s degree, preferably in IT. Post graduate degree / work desirableRequired Qualifications: 5+ years of working experience in the Business Systems Analyst roleThorough understanding of the IIBA BABOK Guide (Business Analysis Body of Knowledge) and it’s applicability to the positionAbility to facilitate user business needs and requirements sessions, articulate resulting requirements to the project team, and document resultsAbility to facilitate user business needs and requirements sessions, articulate resulting requirements to the project team, and document resultsMust be presently authorized to work in the U.S. without a requirement for work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in thePreferred Qualifications: Certifications and experience working in a SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework for Enterprise) methodology highly preferred.Engaging and enthusiastic personality with a strong desire to learn through both structured formal education and self-directed activitiesExperience working on software development projects that have progressed through the full Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC). Experience in an agile environment is preferred.Professional certification in the Business Analysis field is a plus.Experience in Business Process Management and/or Robotic Process Automation is a plusExperience in the insurance industry is a plus.Safety National is committed to fair, transparent pay and we strive to provide competitive, market-based compensation. In our vision to be First with Co-Workers, compensation is only one piece of the comprehensive total rewards package we offer. The target salary range for this position is $84,000 to $135,000. Compensation for the successful candidate will consider the candidate’s particular combination of knowledge, skills, competencies, experience and geographical location.Safety National is a leading specialty insurance and reinsurance provider. Our culture is built upon relationships, which allow us to demonstrate our expertise gained through our rich 80-year history. As a wholly-owned subsidiary of Tokio Marine, Inc., we appreciate the benefits and support provided by our affiliation with one of the top 10 insurance companies in the world.A Benefits Structure That Puts Employees FirstSafety National’s approach to benefits reaches far beyond competitive fixed compensation. Instead, we construct a total rewards benefits package for each valued member of our team. Highlights include incentive award bonuses, an annual holiday bonus, and profit-sharing contributions. Other exceptional benefits include generous healthcare coverage, a 401(k) match, enhanced paid caregiver leave, and family-forming benefits for adoption, surrogacy, and fertility. We also promote balance by offering a hybrid working environment and several employee appreciation events throughout the year. Apply today to learn more about our total rewards approach.

title: Senior Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst
job_description: Company DescriptionRanked among the Top 10 RIAs by Barron’s, Moneta is one of the nation’s premier comprehensive wealth management firms distinguished by a 150-year history of innovation, service, and loyalty to our clients that only an independent company can offer.Job DescriptionThe Senior FP&A Analyst is key in helping lead the budgeting, forecasting and analysis support for the Enterprise Services Team (EST) and partner teams that better equip the VP of Finance, COO and Board of Directors for decision making.The core functions of the Senior FP&A Analyst include building financial models, analysis, planning, forecasting and reporting. The Senior FP&A Analyst utilizes both quantitative and qualitative analysis of all operational aspects of EST and partner teams to evaluate the financial progress towards achieving its goals while mapping out future goals and plans. The Senior FP&A Analyst also considers economic and business trends, reviews past company performance and attempts to anticipate obstacles and potential problems, all while forecasting Moneta’s future financial position with accuracy and clarity.Essential ResponsibilitiesDevelop and implement Partner team financial modeling utilizing Excel for all life cycle events (standard quarterly updates, PIT analysis, Succession modeling & analysis and Ad-hoc analysis). Articulate modeling concepts in a way that are effective, accurate, and easy for the specified audience to understand. Help guide other team members in modeling efforts and presentations to support business decisions. Provide thoughtful input and feedback to enhance existing models, create and implement new models based on management feedback. Help the department with automation and eventually help lead the implementation of planning tools. Collaborate with other EST departments to gather and provide necessary data to grow various applications. Review EST financial forecasting for revenue and help with expense forecasting where necessary. Prepare presentations to partners, Senior Management Team and assist with Board reporting. QualificationsBachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, business, engineering, or a related field is required. A master’s degree (MBA, Master of Finance, Master of Accounting) can be advantageous. The following certifications can be advantageous: CPA, CFA, FPAC. 3+ years of experience in financial modeling and analysis. Proficiency in data analysis, financial modeling and forecasting utilizing advanced Excel techniques and other systems to build models (i.e., SAP, SalesForce etc.)Additional InformationMoneta is committed to providing the best possible care for our employees; part of this care includes offering comprehensive benefits that enhance the wellbeing of employees and their families:Paid holidaysPaid time off (PTO)Employer cost-shared medical and dental insuranceEmployer paid short-term disability, long-term disability, AD&D insurance, and basic life insurance401k Match – 50% of employee contributions up to 6% of compensationDiscretionary annual profit-sharing bonusPaid parental leaveProfessional development reimbursementPaid volunteer time off (VTO)Employee referral incentive bonus programOnsite wellness programs & rewardsEmployee engagement activitiesMoneta is a fiduciary fee-only Registered Investment Advisory firm and unable to hold securities licenses with the exception of Series 65. We also do not allow outside business activities, insurance commissions and/or trails.

title: Financial Analyst (Experienced or Senior)
job_description: Job DescriptionAt Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.Boeing Defense, Space and Security (BDS) is currently seeking a dynamic a Financial Analyst (Experienced or Senior) to join our team in Berkeley, MO.Boeing is at the forefront of innovation in the aerospace and defense industry. We are dedicated to pushing boundaries and creating cutting-edge solutions that shape the future of aerospace technology. Join our dynamic team and be part of an exciting journey where your financial expertise will contribute to the success of our St. Louis Site Fighters programs.As a Financial Analyst you will play a pivotal role collaborating closely with operations, supply chain, engineers, and program managers to ensure the financial success of our cutting-edge projects. This is an exciting opportunity to utilize your financial skills and contribute to the growth and profitability of our organization.Position Responsibilities: Maintains financial controls related to financial system activitiesSupports baseline and estimate at completion system incorporation activitiesReviews and validates change documents (CDs) as part of baseline executionResponsible for financial system month end processing activities and financial system data integrityReviews, analyzes and maintains cost and/or schedule performance measurement baselines, including earned value, and variance analyses and communicates cost and/or schedule trendsPrepares monthly financial reporting deliverables, both internal and externalInitiates variance analyses and provides understanding of operational and financial performance to managementProvides cost reporting utilizing Earned Value Management (EVM)This position is hybrid. This means that the selected candidate will be required to perform some work onsite at one of the listed location options. This is at the hiring team’s discretion and could potentially change in the future.This position must meet export control compliance requirements. To meet export control compliance requirements, a “U.S. Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R.120.15 is required. “U.S. Person” includes U.S. Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee. Basic Qualifications (Required Skills and Experience):Bachelor’s Degree or higher1+ years of experience in a finance related position such as Financial Operations, Cost Management, Accounting, Estimating, Financial Planning, Contracts or Procurement Financial Analysis (PFAExperience with the Microsoft Excel application using: formulas, VLookups, pivot tables, charts, filters, and linking worksheetsPreferred Qualifications (Desired Skills and Experience):3+ years of related work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experienceBachelor’s Degree or higher in Finance, Accounting, Business or related degreeStrong presentation skills and the ability to effectively communicate data in Senior Leadership briefingsExperience in Earned Value Management (EVM)Experience performing Estimates at Complete (EAC)Typical Education/Experience:Experienced (Level 3)Education/experience typically acquired through advanced education (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 6 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience (e.g. Master+4 years' related work experience, 10 years' related work experience, etc.).Senior (Level 4)Education/experience typically acquired through advanced education (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 10 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience (e.g. Master+8 years' related work experience, 14 years' related work experience, etc.).Relocation:This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.Drug Free Workplace:Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.Shift Work: This position is for 1st shift.At Boeing, we strive to deliver a Total Rewards package that will attract, engage and retain the top talent. Elements of the Total Rewards package include competitive base pay and variable compensation opportunities.The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.The specific programs and options available to any given employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.Pay is based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.Summary pay range for Experienced (Level 3): $79,050 - $106,950Summary pay range for Senior (Level 4): $99,450 - $134,550Applications for this position will be accepted through April 30, 2024.Export Control Requirements: U.S. Government Export Control Status: This position must meet export control compliance requirements. To meet export control compliance requirements, a “U.S. Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R.120.15 is required. “U.S. Person” includes U.S. Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.Export Control Details: US based job, US Person requiredEqual Opportunity Employer:Boeing is an Equal Opportunity Employer. title: Data Analysis Instructional Assistant
job_description: Brief DescriptionLaunchCode Instructional Assistants are important and valuable members of a program’s Course Staff. Program Managers and Instructors rely on Instructional Assistants to reinforce the subject knowledge taught in the lecture, teach the application of concepts and skills, and foster a welcoming and supportive learning environment. Instructional Assistants take a very active role in ensuring Learners have high-quality educational and community experiences throughout the course, enabling engagement and retention.At LaunchCode, Instructional Assistants guide a group of Learners as their principal education and support point of contact throughout the LaunchCode program, while simultaneously being able to define and refine their professional development goals. The Instructional Assistant leadership experience provides the opportunity to grow, not just your technical skills, but also public speaking, presentation, people management, and group facilitation skills.Position Details Temporary Part-time, non-exempt, estimated 10-12 hours per week for 26 weeks.In-person at LaunchCode HQ, 4811 Delmar Blvd, St. Louis, MO 63118Class: Tuesdays from 5:30 pm - 8:30 pm, May 21, 2024 - December 3rd, 2024Mandatory Training Sessions:Tues, May 7, 2024Mon, May 11, 2024Tues, May 12, 2024Mon, May 20, 2024Role ResponsibilitiesAttend courses and conduct regularly scheduled office hours on the same day/time each weekSupport and encourage Learners through timely responses via various communication channels such as Discord or emailCollaborate with the Program Manager(s), Director of Career Readiness, and other Course Staff to discuss general concerns, wins, fail points, and areas for improvement, and ideate solutionsPrepare for and facilitate structured in-class activities and unstructured project work timeMake sure learner documentation is up to date by accurate reporting of attendance, graded assignments and learner engagementCoach groups of students to build a final project with encompasses a business issue, exploratory Data Analysis, cleaning data, manipulating and visualizing data using Tableau and Python and statistical modelingAssess student progress through code and project review(s)Set up and monitor group project repositoriesAssist learners in navigating the use of GitHub to create their projects.Administrative duties as assignedQualificationsProfessional experience in a similar technical role and/or graduation from a LaunchCode programPreferred professional experience in one of the following roles or a similar position: Data Analyst, Business Analyst, Data ScientistExperience as a mentor, teacher, or tutorStrong presentation and communication skills; comfortable leading small groups and providing one-on-one teaching assistanceProficiency in LaunchCode’s Data Analysis program languages, tools, frameworks and topics such as Advanced spreadsheet skills, Business issue exploration, Data queries, Data discovery, Exploratory data analysis in Python and T-SQL, Creating visualizations in Tableau, Data cleaning, and Statistics and data modelingExperience in building a Minimum Viable Project with 3-4 working featuresExperience using agile methodologies to manage projectsAdaptable to changing work demands with the ability to use real-time analysis and problem-solving skillsHighly perceptive with the ability to recognize roadblocks impeding learner success and empathetically guide them in problem-solving and resourcefulnessA note to potential candidates: Multiple studies have shown that women, trans, non-binary, BIPOC, individuals with disabilities, and other candidates from marginalized populations are less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they meet every single one of the qualifications in a job description. At LaunchCode, we believe in potential, not credentials, and are committed to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive organization. We care most about finding candidates who have proven they have the aptitude and drive to learn and grow on the job. We would strongly encourage interested folks to apply, even if they don't believe they meet every one of the qualifications described below.About LaunchCodeLaunchCode is a nonprofit cultivating and adding new talent to technology ecosystems across the nation through free, accessible technical education, job readiness training, and innovative talent solutions for companies of all sizes. At LaunchCode, we know that while talent is evenly distributed, opportunity is not. Our innovative model removes barriers and opens doors to aspiring technologists from all walks of life. We value passion, drive, and aptitude over credentials and believe it is imperative that companies should, too.LaunchCode has operations in Saint Louis, Kansas City, and Philadelphia and pop-ups in cities across the country based on employer demand, with the goal of continued national expansion. Want to learn more? Visit our careers page to learn more about how you can help shape our vision!Benefits At LaunchCodePersonal Paid Time OffRobust Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

title: Energy Quantitative Analyst
job_description: JOB TITLE: Energy Quantitative AnalystREQUISITION ID: FOS009YDEPARTMENT: Generation Resources – Kansas City HeadquartersLOCATION: Kansas City, MOScheduled Work Hours: Monday - Friday, 8:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. (Other hours as required)Note: Remote locations will be considered for the right candidate.Summary Of Primary Duties And ResponsibilitiesCandidate will need a strong understanding of financial concepts, energy deal structures and be able to identify transactional risks. Role requires using proprietary built models to price energy derivative instruments, inform the timing of transactions, and assess in managing financial and operations risk. Need to be extremely strong with statistics, quantitative analysis, and modeling. Using these techniques is critical to evaluating energy markets and deal structures. Programming skills are necessary. Candidate must demonstrate advanced knowledge to build financial, fundamental & technical analysis models. Strong experience in modeling with voluminous amounts of data is mandatory; this includes analyzing data, benchmarking, and implementing identified strategies.Education And Experience Requirements Analyst or Senior Analyst: Bachelor’s degree in finance, business, mathematics, engineering, financial engineering, physics, economics, statistics, computer science or an equivalent discipline with a strong emphasis in statistical analysis, finance, computer modeling or problem solving. A master’s degree or PHD in a technical field or certification such as a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) is preferred. Lead Analyst: Master’s degree in degree in finance, business, mathematics, engineering, financial engineering, physics, economics, statistics, computer science or an equivalent discipline with a strong emphasis in statistical analysis, finance, computer modeling or problem solving. A PhD in a technical field or certification as a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) preferred. Minimum of 6 (Senior Analyst) or 8 (Lead Analyst) years of experience working in energy or commodities trading, integrated resource planning, finance, origination marketing or system development.Skills, Knowledge, And Abilities Required Effective oral and written communications skills are required given the complexity of the role, model building and support across multiple groups, and the intricate information and analysis required. High level quantitative, analytical skills with an understanding of U.S. power market structures and fundamentals Proficiency in PowerBI, Excel, and scientific programming languages such as Python or R Ability to manage voluminous amounts of data with ability to visualize data and identify pattern trends Understand how to do a decomposition of market prices and structured deals Knowledge and application of machine learning as needed Strong statistical background with ability to design develop new predictive/analytical modeling toolsLicenses, Certifications, Bonding, and/or Testing Required: NoneWorking Conditions: Normal office working conditions.Evergy has a clear mission – To empower a better future. Evergy chooses to live this mission by valuing People First. We know that to lead the responsible energy transition and provide affordable, reliable, and sustainable service to our customers and communities, we need a team with a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. So, our goal is to be a diverse workforce that is representative of the communities we serve. We are committed to celebrating diversity and building a team where everyone – regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status – has a voice and can bring their best every day. We know that the more diverse and inclusive we are, the better we will be. Evergy is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer.Disclaimer: The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. job_description: Job DescriptionAt Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place.
